eu.davidea.viewholders

Class ContentViewHolder

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder
      • eu.davidea.viewholders.ContentViewHolder
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FlexibleViewHolder

    abstract class ContentViewHolder
extends androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView.ViewHolder
    This Class separates the initialization of an eventual StickyHeader ViewHolder from a Normal ViewHolder. It improves code readability of FlexibleViewHolder.

    Because itemView is declared final, we can't initialize it twice, this separation must be done in the constructor.

    Since:
    18/06/2016 Created

      • ContentViewHolder

        ContentViewHolder(android.view.View view,
                  FlexibleAdapter adapter,
                  boolean stickyHeader)
        Parameters:
        view - The View being hosted in this ViewHolder
        adapter - Adapter instance of type FlexibleAdapter
        stickyHeader - true if the ViewHolder is a header to be sticky
        Since:
        5.0.0-b7

    • Method Detail

      • getContentView

        public final android.view.View getContentView()
        In case this ViewHolder represents a Header Item, this method returns the contentView of the FrameLayout, otherwise it returns the basic itemView.
        Returns:
        the real contentView
        Since:
        5.0.0-b7

      • getFlexibleAdapterPosition

        public final int getFlexibleAdapterPosition()
        Overcomes the situation of returning an unknown position (-1) of ViewHolders created out of the LayoutManager (ex. StickyHeaders).

        NOTE: Always call this method, instead of getAdapterPosition(), in case of StickyHeaders use case.

        Returns:
        the Adapter position result of RecyclerView.ViewHolder.getAdapterPosition() OR the backup position preset and known, if the previous result was RecyclerView.NO_POSITION.
        Since:
        5.0.0-b6
        See Also:
        setBackupPosition(int)

      • setBackupPosition

        public final void setBackupPosition(int backupPosition)
        Restore the Adapter position if the original Adapter position is unknown.

        Called by StickyHeaderHelper to support the clickListeners events.

        Parameters:
        backupPosition - the known position of this ViewHolder
        Since:
        5.0.0-b6
